metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
As the Data Product Manager Lead you will work on transforming the world’s largest research-consented recontactable genetics database into a powerful product that can help accelerate the discovery, validation, and distribution of cures for some of the most destructive health conditions that plague us today.

Who We Are
We are a group of individuals passionate about genetic discovery. 23andMe Research Institute is a nonprofit medical research organization that enables people everywhere to access their genetic information, learn about themselves, and participate in the world's largest crowdsourced research initiative. The Institute aims to be the world's most significant contributor to scientific advancement, uniting people with the common goal of improving health and deepening our understanding of DNA — the code of life.

What You’ll Do
Build enterprise data products that are driven by 23andMe’s proprietary genetic data and analytical capabilities that address meaningful needs for 23andMe’s external partners (e.g., biotech and pharmaceutical companies, research institutions)
Collaborate with research leaders to establish a vision and strategy for product development that builds on ongoing projects
Establish cross-functional relationships with computational scientists, bioinformaticians, business development, engineering, marketing, and design to define product requirements, specify scope, and drive timelines
Create detailed road maps, prioritize relentlessly, and communicate trade-offs internally
Define success metrics, measure, and evaluate the impact of product efforts
Analyze and understand data, and leverage that understanding to make data-driven decisions
Work closely with 23andMe scientists and the business development team to communicate the value of the product to potential customers and gather feedback about what would help advance success rates in drug discovery and other applications of the data

What You’ll Bring
8+ years experience in product management
Proven ability to lead a team to meet concrete milestones
Strong analytical skills
Ability to build relationships and effectively collaborate with all levels of the organization, from C-level to individual contributors
Ability to manage and influence through persuasion, negotiation, and consensus building
Enthusiasm and creativity to inspire others
Deep experience with building enterprise B2B products for healthcare and life science customers
History of developing and successfully launching data products in the past

Strongly Preferred
Advanced degree (MS, PhD) in a relevant life sciences field
Scientific research experience; solid understanding of genetics-driven research and drug target discovery (e.g., genome-wide association studies (GWAS))
Familiarity with UX and information architecture best practices
Experience building up and leading a PM team


About Us

23andMe, headquartered in California, is a leading consumer genetics and research company. The company’s mission is to help people access, understand, and benefit from the human genome. 23andMe has pioneered direct access to genetic information as the only company with multiple FDA authorizations for genetic health risk reports. The company has created the world’s largest crowdsourced platform for genetic research, with 80 percent of its customers electing to participate. 23andMe research participants consent to research conducted by 23andMe which is overseen by an independent third-party Institutional Review Board (IRB) regulated under the 'Common Rule' (45 CFR part 46). More information is available at www.23andme.com/research.

At 23andMe, we value a diverse, inclusive workforce and we provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. All qualified applicants for employment will be considered without regard to an individual’s race, color, sex, gender identity, gender expression, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws.  If you are unable to submit your application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at accommodations-ext@23andme.com. 23andMe will reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with disabilities to the extent required by applicable law.

Please note: 23andMe does not accept agency resumes and we are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Thank you.

metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
23andMe is looking for a design leader that has a wealth of experience in building world-class product UX, product design and marketing design teams. You have a strong visual aesthetic and an eye for creating world class experiences. You are passionate about health and ancestry, our consumers, their user perspectives and the brand journey they are on. We are looking for an exceptional design leader, thinker and communicator to take the brand and product design to the next level and pioneer uncharted territory. You will be responsible for working closely with Product, Engineering and Marketing to produce a one-of-a kind experience, and you excel at building strong cross-functional relationships in a fast-paced organization. 
You will lead the product design team at 23andMe, but ultimately serve the customer. You’re an expert at collaborating, communicating down, up and sideways, so everyone is aware and in sync. You have an understanding of how big and little improvements drive a business forward - and you can do more than just come up with big ideas, you know how to manage teams to get them done. You love directly delivering designs as the majority of your work even as you help coordinate the team overall.
 Who We Are
We are a group of individuals passionate about genetic discovery. 23andMe Research Institute is a nonprofit medical research organization that enables people everywhere to access their genetic information, learn about themselves, and participate in the world's largest crowdsourced research initiative. The Institute aims to be the world's most significant contributor to scientific advancement, uniting people with the common goal of improving health and deepening our understanding of DNA — the code of life.
 
What You'll Do
Lead the 23andMe product design team, guiding them to deliver excellent UI/UX, interaction and visual design.
Personally drive and deliver prolific and high quality product design output
Expand and perfect our in-house design process. As experiences move from requirements to design to execution, we will look to you to ensure our designs meet brand expectations while driving business results. You will play a critical role in creating a brand accessible to everyone, and making our product understandable and actionable. 
Mentor and grow a talented team of designers to sharpen their craft and deepen their impact. Set clear goals, manage project loads, and ensure high-quality deliverables. Someone who empowers growth and supports design decisions across all teams.
Champion the consumer. Obsess over the consumer. Empathize with the consumer. You will drive visual and UX teams in the pursuit of consistent and high quality experiences.
Collaborate cross-functionally with product management, scientists, marketing, engineering to develop and evolve product and marketing processes, strategy, and roadmap.
Willing to take risks and push design boundaries - and has a clear POV that can articulate a concept and hold their opinion, while balancing feedback to get to yes/no quickly.
 
What You'll Bring
6-8 years of work experience focusing on product design and user interface across various platforms, including web, iOS, and Android.
5+ years working collaboratively across engineering, product management and user research teams.
A strong track record of shipped products and services that demonstrates compelling product direction, showcasing a perspective on the creative process and aesthetic.
Experience working on end-user facing products and experiences.
Passion to be the voice of design with visibility across our entire organization
Design leadership experience across the entire product lifecycle managing multiple concurrent projects and budgets.
User insight and a passion for making peoples' lives better through great product experiences and campaigns.
Excellent communication skills and ability to clearly explain direction and decisions.
Experience leading technical discussions with engineering promoting high-quality design systems across all product features and platforms.
Experience simultaneously managing a variety of complex features with technical and legal constraints.
Ability to pivot through creative problem-solving.
Genuine passion for health, science, and education.
Bachelors Degree in HCI, Graphic Design, Media Arts or similar a plus.
About Us
23andMe, headquartered in California, is a leading consumer genetics and research company. The company’s mission is to help people access, understand, and benefit from the human genome. 23andMe has pioneered direct access to genetic information as the only company with multiple FDA authorizations for genetic health risk reports. The company has created the world’s largest crowdsourced platform for genetic research, with 80 percent of its customers electing to participate. 23andMe research participants consent to research conducted by 23andMe which is overseen by an independent third-party Institutional Review Board (IRB) regulated under the 'Common Rule' (45 CFR part 46). More information is available at www.23andme.com/research.
At 23andMe, we value a diverse, inclusive workforce and we provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. All qualified applicants for employment will be considered without regard to an individual’s race, color, sex, gender identity, gender expression, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws.  If you are unable to submit your application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at accommodations-ext@23andme.com. 23andMe will reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with disabilities to the extent required by applicable law.
Please note: 23andMe does not accept agency resumes and we are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Thank you.

metadata.name: Job Description
metadata.value:
At 23andMe, we're building a new kind of preventative healthcare, powered by a unique dataset that combines deep genetic information with ongoing health data from lab tests, surveys, and EMRs. We’re looking for an AI product leader to architect the intelligence that transforms this rich, multimodal data into a trusted health companion. You will define and build the next generation of AI-powered features that provide continuous, clinician-backed guidance. This is a rare opportunity to shape a product that helps people proactively manage and improve their long-term health.
What You’ll Do
Own the Feature Roadmap: Own and execute the product roadmap for a core set of new AI-powered health features, from initial concept through launch and iteration.
Translate Vision into Reality: Specify detailed product requirements for new mobile-first features that use AI to deliver empathetic, trustworthy, and deeply personalized health insights.
Drive Engagement Loops: Partner with engineering and design to build and optimize features that encourage users to understand their health, take action, and build a lasting relationship with our products.
Execute with a Cross-Functional Team: Drive feature development by building powerful relationships and seamless processes with R&D, engineering, analytics, design, and marketing.
Define and Measure Success: Establish and own the key metrics for your features. Analyze user data and product performance to make informed, data-driven decisions for future iterations.
Be the Voice of the Customer: Collaborate with our consumer insights and product marketing teams to deeply understand user needs, fears, and motivations in the digital health space.

What You’ll Bring
5+ years of product management experience with a proven track record of launching successful, consumer-facing web and mobile applications.
A BS/MS in Computer Science, Engineering, Bioinformatics, Statistics, or a related technical field, or equivalent experience.
Deep, hands-on understanding of the end-to-end lifecycle of machine learning models, from data collection and feature engineering to model evaluation and deployment.
Fluency with data analysis; you are comfortable writing your own queries and building dashboards to monitor product health and model performance.
Excellent communication skills, with the ability to articulate a compelling product vision and navigate complex technical trade-offs with both engineering and executive teams.
Proficiency in using LLMs in your daily workflow to ideate, iterate, and deliver products more quickly.
Note: Ability to work from 23andMe's office mid-Peninsula, CA a minimum of 3 days per week

Strongly Preferred
Direct, hands-on experience building and launching AI/ML-powered products, especially those involving LLMs, NLP, recommendation engines, or predictive modeling.
Experience building products that leverage large-scale, heterogeneous datasets (e.g., genomic, clinical, behavioral).
Familiarity with data privacy and security considerations in a regulated environment (e.g., HIPAA).
Eagerness to collaborate with world-class researchers to build novel products powered by cutting-edge science.


About Us
23andMe, headquartered in California, is a leading consumer genetics and research company. The company’s mission is to help people access, understand, and benefit from the human genome. 23andMe has pioneered direct access to genetic information as the only company with multiple FDA authorizations for genetic health risk reports. The company has created the world’s largest crowdsourced platform for genetic research, with 80 percent of its customers electing to participate. 23andMe research participants consent to research conducted by 23andMe which is overseen by an independent third-party Institutional Review Board (IRB) regulated under the 'Common Rule' (45 CFR part 46). More information is available at www.23andme.com/research.
At 23andMe, we value a diverse, inclusive workforce and we provide equal employment opportunity for all applicants and employees. All qualified applicants for employment will be considered without regard to an individual’s race, color, sex, gender identity, gender expression, religion, age, national origin or ancestry, citizenship, physical or mental disability, medical condition, family care status, marital status, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other basis protected by federal, state or local laws.  If you are unable to submit your application because of incompatible assistive technology or a disability, please contact us at accommodations-ext@23andme.com. 23andMe will reasonably accommodate qualified individuals with disabilities to the extent required by applicable law.
Please note: 23andMe does not accept agency resumes and we are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes. Thank you.
